page.title: 01Cheshire Countryside
page.content: Mainly a farming community with two villages. The larger being Bunbury, Alpraham the smaller. The northern section is cut through by the Crewe-Holyhead Railway, the Shropshire Union Canal and the busy A51. The 14th century church at Bunbury dominates the area to the west immediatly overlooking a working corn mill standing on the narrow River Gowy flowing south to north towards the Mersey. The Chester-Holyhead Railway runs mainly in a cutting and since there is now very little freight traffic, passing trains are hardly noticed. The Shropshire Union Canal is well used for pleasure boats and the areas at Calveley, Bunbury and Tilstone Locks are very busy during the Summer Season.
